subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Ebay auction for sorta Frank's Box?
author: SnowfireL@aol.com
full_text:
-------------------------------1242885555
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

I saw that add a while back, and were not for Steve and Bruce,  I  would 
have bought one from him, I didn't know.sf
 
 
In a message dated 5/21/2009 1:50:37 A.M. Eastern Daylight Time,  
ourobouros2k2@... writes:

 
 


Been following this unprofessional idiot's items for awhile now. I love how 
 he says that Frank charges thousands of dollars for an original Frank's 
box.  

This dude is the worst type of con, preying on people who know only  enough 
to be familiar with the term Frank's box. Then again, it always has  
bothered me when people take shack hacks and charge stupid prices for them on  
ebay under the Frank's box moniker.

This guy is based out of Nevada I  believe, and his group's ethics leave 
little to be desired. Takes all kinds, I  reckon...

Andy

--- In _EVP-ITC@yahoogroupsEVP-_ (mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com) ,  
Aquarius <laustin@...> wrote:
>
> Hmmm... saw this on  Ebay tonight... you've got to read all the text to 
hear
> how he  describes what he's selling. 
> 
> Do any of you on this list know  who he is? I just thought this was kind 
of
> interesting. interestin
> 
> _http://tinyurl.http://tin_ (http://tinyurl.com/o5pper) 
>  
> Cheers,
> 
> Leslie, consistent lurker and occasional  poster <g>
> 
> "I'm not happy, I'm cheerful. There's a  difference. A happy woman has no
> cares at all. A cheerful woman has  cares but has learned how to deal 
with them."
> 
> -- Beverly  Sills (1929-) American Opera Singer
>
